title: Can rising American Taylor Fritz topple Carlos Alcaraz at Wimbledon?
content: It's a tall order to say the least, but Fritz has a chance to be the first American man to make the Wimbledon final since 2009.

title: Flagg makes 'winning plays' in uneven debut
content: Cooper Flagg made his professional debut Thursday night in the NBA summer league and celebrated an 87-85 win over Bronny James and the Lakers.

title: Agent: Bolts' Harris hurt eye in fireworks incident
content: Najee Harris suffered an eye injury in a July 4 fireworks incident, but his agent said the Chargers running back "is fully expected to be ready for the upcoming NFL season."

title: Yanks, no-hit through 7, down 5-0, rally past M's
content: Anthony Volpe scored with an acrobatic slide on Aaron Judge's sacrifice fly in the 10th inning, and the Yankees rallied past Seattle after being no-hit for seven innings.

title: Fore! Barkley is longest shot in celeb golf tourney
content: Charles Barkley, who finished a career-best 58th last year, remains the biggest long shot to win this week's American Century Championship celebrity golf tournament.

title: Pelicans, Jones agree to 3-year, $68M extension
content: Pelicans forward Herb Jones has agreed to a three-year, $68 million contract extension with the franchise.

title: Bregman 'in a great place,' to return for Red Sox
content: Red Sox third baseman Alex Bregman, who has been sidelined since May 24 with a strained right quad, will "play this weekend," manager Alex Cora said.

title: Mets' Peterson gets 1st ASG nod as sub for Ray
content: Mets pitcher David Peterson was added to the National League roster for the All-Star Game on Thursday, replacing Giants left-hander Robbie Ray.

title: NCAA says March Madness expansion 'still viable'
content: The committees for men's and women's Division I basketball met this week to discuss possible expansion of the March Madness tournaments, but made no immediate decisions or recommendations.

title: 📸 Dodgers unveil Kobe Bryant bobblehead
content: The first 40,000 ticketed fans for the Dodgers' matchup against the Blue Jays on Aug. 8 will receive the bobblehead.

title: MLB mock draft 3.0: Kiley McDaniel predicts the first two rounds
content: The MLB draft is Sunday! And this year, the drama starts with the Washington Nationals at the No. 1 pick.

title: LeBron to Luka: Inside the most delicate superstar transition in NBA history
content: For months, publicly and privately, the Lakers have been signaling their desire to begin the Luka Doncic era in Los Angeles, even if it meant ending the LeBron James one.

title: The NBA is closing in on its first $1 million per game player
content: The reigning MVP will get close, but the league is still waiting for its first $82 million per year player.

title: Wetzel: Why the NFLPA mess should matter to football fans
content: It behooves the competitive balance of the NFL to have strong ownership and strong labor, Wetzel writes.

title: Who are the NFL's best tight ends? Execs, coaches and scouts help rank 2025's top 10
content: Execs, coaches, scouts and players from around the NFL ranked their top 10 tight ends in our annual summer series.

title: How do you decide between Skubal, Fried, deGrom and Crochet? All-Star manager Aaron Boone has his work cut out for him
content: The Yankees' skipper gets to pick the American League's starting pitcher for the All-Star Game. Here are the cases for each top pitcher.

title: Colorado's reload, Arizona State's repeat bid, and the return of Utah and K-State
content: The Big 12 had a surprise champion and the Heisman Trophy winner in 2024. What happens in the league in 2025?

title: We graded the offseason: Here's who crushed it and flubbed it, from the Rams (A) to the Saints (D)
content: We handed out offseason report cards to all 32 NFL teams, factoring in signings, extensions, trades, draft picks, hirings -- you name it.

title: From adding talent to losing captains: NHL teams that changed the most this offseason
content: From the Sharks to the Stars, here are 12 teams most impacted by offseason moves -- for better and for worse.

title: College football's top 25 teams have their archvillains, and we have a pick for each
content: These are the players, coaches, teams and concepts that every squad in our Way-Too-Early Top 25 will be looking out for in 2025.

title: How every five-star college football recruit fits at his new school
content: There are 23 five-stars in the Class of 2026. We look at how they got to their teams and what they'll do in college.

title: The perfect trade deadline addition for every MLB contender
content: A star outfielder to the NL West? A powerful slugger dealt to New York? We make moves for every World Series hopeful.

title: Expert picks, best bets: Former heavyweight title contender Derrick Lewis is back
content: Who has the edge in this week's UFC Fight Night? MMA analysts and former UFC fighters Anthony Smith and Din Thomas make their picks.

title: PLL Week 7 preview: Key stats, players for throwback weekend
content: The action heads to Chicago on Friday and Saturday. Here's the full schedule, key stats, injury notes, more.

title: Lamine Yamal's 18th birthday: Barcelona, Spain star's meteoric rise in 18 key moments
content: Happy birthday, Lamine Yamal! To celebrate the Barcelona and Spain phenom turning 18, here is the story of his extraordinary life and career so far.

title: Source: Seattle's Fishel deal hits NWSL record
content: Seattle Reign FC has signed United States women's national team forward Mia Fishel on a transfer from Chelsea.

title: Bale backs Alonso to make 'big changes' at Madrid
content: Former Real Madrid star Gareth Bale has backed new head coach Xabi Alonso to make "big changes" at the club, saying that he won't be afraid to drop anyone.

title: Wenger doesn't 'share Klopp's view' of CWC
content: Arsene Wenger has dismissed Jurgen Klopp's criticism of FIFA's revamped 32-team Club World Cup, calling the tournament a "fantastic competition" and emphasising the support it has received from participating teams, players, and managers. Klopp, the...

title: USWNT great Tobin Heath announces retirement
content: USWNT great Tobin Heath has announced her retirement from soccer, almost three years after her last appearance.

title: Source: Smith set for world-record Arsenal transfer
content: Olivia Smith is set to become the first player in the women's game to command a transfer fee of £1 million as Arsenal seek to secure her signature from Liverpool, a source has told ESPN.

title: Tottenham complete Kudus signing from West Ham
content: Tottenham Hotspur have completed the signing of midfielder Mohammed Kudus from West Ham United, the clubs announced Thursday.

title: AC Milan-Como in Oz? Italy's FA approves request
content: AC Milan's Serie A match vs Como could be Europe's first major league game played abroad after Italy's FA approved plans to stage it in Australia.

title: USMNT's Vázquez tears ACL, blow to WC hopes
content: Austin forward Brandon Vázquez tore his right ACL, an injury that will hamper his chances of making the United States roster for next year's World Cup.

title: ⚽ 'To New York': Chelsea hit back at Flamengo
content: Flamengo's social media account trolled Chelsea multiple times after defeating them in the CWC group stage.

title: Is the United States too hot to handle the 2026 FIFA Men's World Cup?
content: The 2025 Club World Cup has been punctuated by a brutal heat wave in the U.S. that has left players and coaches flustered. The bigger question: What will such weather do for next summer's World Cup?

title: Katie Taylor ready to complete Amanda Serrano trilogy at MSG
content: With her junior welterweight title on the line in a legendary rivalry, the champ reflects on a life in boxing.

title: Who is Red Bull's new boss, and can he keep Max?
content: In the wake of Red Bull's bombshell decision to sack Christian Horner this week, it was easy to miss the name of the man replacing him: Laurent Mekies.

title: 50 days, 50 states: Durant, Reese headline top hoopers from D.C.-area high schools
content: As part of SportsCenter's "50 States in 50 Days" tour, we're spotlighting the top boys and girls hoopers to come out of D.C., Maryland and Virginia based on career achievements, legacy and lasting impact on the game.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Barcelona eye Lookman after Williams snub
content: Barcelona are interested in Atalanta winger Ademola Lookman. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: Watch: Rhino Goes On Rampage In Assam Village, Locals Flee In Panic
content: A rhinoceros, who strayed away 150 kilometers away from Assam's Kaziranga National Park, was seen displaying aggressive behavior in the Demow village.

title: State Department To Fire Over 1,300 Employees Under Trump Administration Plan
content: The State Department is firing more than 1,300 employees on Friday in line with a dramatic reorganization plan initiated by the Trump administration earlier this year.

title: On One Nation, One Election, Ex Top Judges' Note Against "Unbridled Power": Sources
content: The Election Commission of India should not be given unbridled powers in implementing the One Nation, One Election system, former Chief Justices of India DY Chandrachud and JS Khehar told a Joint Parliamentary Committee (JPC), as per sources.

title: Row Over RSS Chief's 'Retire At 75' Comment, Opposition Reads Between Lines
content: Rashtriya Swayamsevak Sangh (RSS) chief Mohan Bhagwat's comments on leaders stepping back at 75 have stirred the pot, with the opposition taking digs at the ruling BJP.

title: Tennis Player Radhika Yadav's Autopsy Report Shows She Was Shot 4 Times
content: Tennis player Radhika Yadav, who was killed by her father at their Gurugram home, was shot four times, says the autopsy report.

title: "50 Khokhe, Ekdum Okay": Aaditya Thackeray Over Sena Minister's "Cash" Video
content: Aaditya Thackeray made a serious charge, leavened with a touch of playfulness and an attempt at achieving a rhythmic quality to it with his "50 khokhe, ekdum okay" jab at a Maharashtra Minister.

title: On Camera, Odisha Couple Tied To Yoke Like Oxen, Made To Plough Field
content: Intent on punishing and humiliating a young couple for marrying against local societal norms, a mob in Odisha tied them to a yoke, like oxen, and made them plough a field.

title: 22-Year-Old Woman Sells Own Child For Rs 50,000 In Assam
content: A 22-year-old unmarried woman, who had recently given birth in Assam's Sivasagar civil hospital, allegedly sold her child for Rs 50,000, according to officials.

title: 'Punishing States': On Population Day, MK Stalin Pushes For Fair Delimitation
content: Tamil Nadu Chief Minister and DMK leader MK Stalin used the occasion of World Population Day to renew his demand for a "fair delimitation" of parliamentary constituencies, warning against what he called an attempt to "punish" progressive states.

title: Blog: Blog | Deporting Elon Musk? What Happens If Trump Actually Does It
content: Let's be honest - scrolling through an endless stream of headlines can feel like deja vu on loop. After a while, every story starts to blur, your eyes glaze over, and your brain is begging for something that actually makes you sit up straight.

title: Day After Tax Notice, Maharashtra Minister Seen With Bag Allegedly Full Of Cash
content: A day after an income tax notice was served to him to explain his exponential financial growth, Maharashtra Minister Sanjay Shirsat was seen smoking in a room with a bag, allegedly full of cash, next to him.

title: Iran Could Recover Enriched Uranium Buried Under Isfahan Nuclear Site, Says Israel
content: In a briefing with reporters on Wednesday, the Israeli official said that accessing the uranium buried at Isfahan would be difficult and if Iran tried attempting it, it would be detected and Israel would resume the strikes.

title: Opinion: Opinion | Gurugram And Its 'Manhattan' Dreams: Fake It Till You Flood It
content: While news pages are moaning about waterlogged roads in the city, there is a builder boldly advertising, in a newspaper jacket, "luxe suites" in an imaginatively titled "South of Gurugram".

title: Mother Sells Her Newborn For Rs 50,000 In Assam, 5 Arrested: Cops
content: A 22-year-old woman who recently gave birth to her newborn in Sivasagar Civil Hospital in Assam allegedly sold her infant for Rs 50,000. The mother was not married but became pregnant and gave birth to a child recently, according to official sources.

title: Iran's Drone Strike On Donald Trump Threat, His "Not Too Big Into..." Reply
content: US President Donald Trump has responded to remarks of a senior Iranian figure suggesting a drone strike on him could be possible. The comments have drawn renewed attention to ongoing tensions between Washington and Tehran.

title: Poll Body Has Hatched New 'Chunav Chori' Conspiracy In Bihar: Rahul Gandhi
content: Congress MP Rahul Gandhi on Friday accused the Election Commission of India of "hatching a conspiracy" for "chunav chori" in Bihar, referring to the poll panel's decision to revise electoral rolls in the state ahead of the Assembly elections.

title: Ancient Mayan King's Tomb Filled With Treasures Found In Central America
content: Archaeologists in Belize have discovered the tomb of the first ruler of the ancient Maya city of Caracol.

title: Telangana Cabinet Approves 42% Backward Classes Reservation in Local Body Polls
content: In a move aimed at empowering Backward Classes (BCs) and fulfilling a key poll promise, the Telangana Cabinet, led by Chief Minister A. Revanth Reddy, on Thursday, approved a proposal to extend 42% reservation to BCs in local body elections.

title: "Show Me 1 Photo": Ajit Doval's Dare To Foreign Media On Op Sindoor Claims
content: National Security Advisor Ajit Doval on Friday slammed foreign media for their reportage of Operation Sindoor, challenging them to give proof of damage to Indian infrastructure by Pakistani strikes.

title: European Leaders Announce Equity Fund For Ukraine, Urge Investments
content: European leaders urged private business and equity on Thursday to invest in rebuilding Ukraine now, even as Russia accelerates its war.

title: 'Whole issue was ... ': What Radhika Yadav's father told police about her murder
content: Gurugram Police have refuted speculation surrounding the murder of national tennis player Radhika Yadav, clarifying that her father, Deepak Yadav, committed the crime due to disagreements over her running a tennis academy. Despite the family's financial stability from rental properties, Deepak objected to Radhika's work, leading to frequent arguments and ultimately, the fatal shooting at their residence.

title: Shubman Gill argues with umpire, Broad highlights 'problem'
content: During the third Test at Lord's, India's repeated requests to change the Dukes ball due to shape issues became a major talking point, frustrating players and coaches alike. Despite the ball concerns, England mounted a fightback, led by Jamie Smith's counter-attacking fifty and Brydon Carse's resistance, while Jasprit Bumrah's fiery spell rattled England's middle order.

title: Microsoft layoffs: Company cuts 15,000 jobs; tells remaining employees to invest
content: Microsoft is urging its remaining workforce to enhance their AI skills after significant layoffs impacting over 15,000 employees this year. The company is integrating AI usage into performance reviews and shifting its sales strategy towards technically proficient "solutions engineers." This move comes amidst substantial AI investments and a company-wide push for Copilot adoption.

title: 'Absolute highways': Starc surprised by pitches, says he’d hate bowling to Gill
content: Mitchell Starc voiced his astonishment at the batting-friendly pitches in the India-England Test series, labeling them "absolute highways." He admitted he wouldn't want to bowl to a in-form Shubman Gill on such surfaces. Starc observed the conditions resembled the sub-continent, making it challenging for bowlers, while dismissing concerns about high scores in England.

title: 'Show me 1 photo': NSA Doval dares foreign media on Operation Sindoor
content: National Security Advisor (NSA) Ajit Doval criticised foreign media for allegedly misleading coverage of India's 'Operation Sindoor,' a counterterror military action against Pakistan. Doval highlighted the precision of the operation, which targeted nine terrorist hubs deep inside Pakistan and PoK, and challenged the Western media to show evidence of Indian damage.

title: 'Couldn't speak against Trump': Congress chief Kharge's jibe at PM Modi
content: Mallikarjun Kharge criticised PM Modi for allegedly failing to counter Donald Trump's claim of ending the India-Pakistan war. Modi, during his Canada visit, clarified to Trump that India wouldn't accept mediation with Pakistan. He also declined Trump's dinner invitation to attend a public program in Odisha, emphasising his commitment to the "land of Mahaprabhu."

title: Top engineer quits Musk’s AI firm: Joins OpenAI; says ‘Jensen Huang was right, Elon & his teams…’
content: Uday Ruddarraju, xAI's head of infrastructure engineering, has resigned after a year, having been instrumental in building the Colossus supercomputer and training Grok 3. He expressed gratitude to Elon Musk and the xAI team for the experience. Shortly after his departure, Ruddarraju announced he is joining OpenAI, with OpenAI President Greg Brockman welcoming him and other engineers.

title: DRS drama at Lord's! How Bumrah's sharp ears put him on a hattrick
content: Jasprit Bumrah's fiery spell on Day 2 of the third Test at Lord's rattled England's batting lineup, dismissing captain Ben Stokes and Joe Root. Bumrah's delivery sent Stokes back for 44, while Root fell after reaching his century, marking Bumrah's 11th dismissal of the former England captain in Tests. A successful review secured Woakes' wicket, further solidifying Bumrah's impact.

title: KL, not again! Siraj fumes after another KL Rahul drop
content: Tensions rose at Lord's as Joe Root reached his century, compounded by Mohammed Siraj's visible frustration after KL Rahul dropped a catch off Jamie Smith. This missed opportunity, coupled with Jadeja's earlier concerns about Rahul's attentiveness, added to the pressure. The series stands level at 1-1, intensifying the importance of each moment in the ongoing Test match.

title: Microsoft’s internal memo to employees: Will replace sales roles by…
content: Microsoft is restructuring its sales division to focus on artificial intelligence, leading to 9,000 job cuts. The company aims to become a leading AI firm by replacing traditional sales roles with technically skilled "solutions engineers." This shift involves streamlining sales efforts and consolidating solutions areas to better promote AI tools like Copilot.

title: Radhika Yadav murder: Music video featuring Gurgaon tennis coach surfaces
content: Radhika Yadav, a 25-year-old tennis coach, was allegedly murdered by her father at their Gurgaon home. A music video featuring Radhika in a lead role surfaced after the incident, prompting police to investigate if it contributed to the conflict. The father confessed, citing financial dependence on his daughter as a source of tension.

title: DOGE falling apart: Key Musk-aligned staff quit agency
content: The elite federal task force DOGE, created to overhaul the US government under Elon Musk, is losing influence as key officials and engineers depart following Musk's exit from day-to-day operations. Despite these departures, the White House asserts that DOGE's mission to improve government efficiency and eliminate waste continues, highlighting significant savings and ongoing projects like AI.gov.

title: Joe Root breaks Rahul Dravid's record, now among top 5 century scorers in Tests
content: Joe Root's magnificent form continues as he scores his 37th Test century against India at Lord's, reaching the milestone with a boundary off Jasprit Bumrah. This century marks Root's third consecutive ton at the Home of Cricket, placing him alongside legends Jack Hobbs and Michael Vaughan.

title: Gisele Bündchen: 'Death of my dream' confession — sparks healing journey — post-Tom Brady divorce
content: Gisele Bundchen spoke about her divorce from Tom Brady in March 2024. She described it as the death of her dream. Bundchen dismissed media claims that Brady's return to football caused the split. She expressed continued support for Brady's happiness and success. Bundchen is focusing on her own truth and has grown close to Joaquim Valente.

title: 'Her BBL smelled like trash bag': Diggs hits back; responds after denying Cardi B breakup rumors
content: Stefon Diggs has refuted claims that he called Cardi B "smelly" due to her BBL, dismissing the rumors as false. This comes after Cardi B removed pictures from her Instagram, sparking breakup speculations among fans. Despite the rumors and cryptic social media posts, the couple seems to be going strong, with Diggs posting a video of them working out together.

title: 'No one will last with her': Astrologer predicts trouble for Swift-Kelce; breakup on cards?
content: Astrologer Mark Du Boise predicts potential heartbreak for Taylor Swift and Travis Kelce, despite their public displays of affection. Du Boise cites conflicting astrological signs, suggesting Swift's inner tension and Kelce's hesitation could doom their relationship. While fans remain optimistic, the astrologer's claims have sparked debate, but the couple continues to showcase their bond.

title: Slapgate row: Case registered against Sena MLA for slapping canteen worker
content: Mumbai police filed a case against Shiv Sena MLA Sanjay Gaikwad for allegedly slapping a canteen worker. He faced criticism for the incident and claims of serving stale food. The FDA suspended the canteen's license and collected food samples. Gaikwad further sparked controversy by accusing the Shetty community of damaging Maharashtra's culture through questionable businesses in Mumbai.

title: Who is Sofia Vergara? 53-year-old stuns at Bezos’ wedding; reports link her to Tom Brady
content: Tom Brady's appearance with Sofia Vergara at Jeff Bezos' wedding has sparked romance rumors, surprising fans after his years away from dating speculation. Vergara, a successful actress known for 'Modern Family,' recently divorced Joe Manganiello. Kim Kardashian and Sydney Sweeney are also reportedly in the mix, adding to the drama surrounding Brady's potential new relationship.

title: ‘Unnecessary barriers…’: US slams India on dairy certificates; raises issue amidst trade talks
content: Amidst ongoing discussions for an interim trade agreement, the US has again raised concerns at the WTO regarding India's dairy certificate requirements, deeming them unnecessary obstacles for American exports. India has also proposed retaliatory tariffs against the US on steel and aluminium.

title: Pakistan bus attack: Rebels check IDs, kill 9 passengers
content: In a tragic incident in Pakistan's Balochistan province, nine individuals were fatally shot by rebels after being abducted from passenger buses. The victims were identified based on their Punjab origins, as revealed by their identity cards. The Balochistan Liberation Front (BLA) claimed responsibility for the attack, highlighting the ongoing insurgency and targeting of non-Baloch civilians.

title: Air India crash: Report may explain what went wrong; peek into final moments expected
content: A preliminary report on the Air India 171 crash, which killed 241 onboard and over 30 on the ground, is expected soon. Investigators are focusing on the possibility of fuel control switch movement as a potential cause for the dual engine failure shortly after takeoff.

title: Inside India's skill divide: Top performing states; vocational trends
content: PARAKH Rashtriya Sarvekshan 2024 reveals uneven progress in vocational education. Gujarat leads in school offerings, but student enrollment lags in states like Bihar and Odisha. Delhi and Chandigarh show high student interest despite fewer resources. The report emphasizes the need for awareness and relevant courses. Bridging the gap between provision and participation is crucial for a skilled future.

title: ‘Paisa double’ trap: How Bengaluru woman used kitty parties as bait; 30 duped of Rs 5 crore
content: Savita G, a 49-year-old woman, and her accomplice, Puneet P, were arrested for allegedly defrauding her social circle of over Rs 5 crore. Savita lured women from affluent backgrounds with promises of high-return investments in gold imports and real estate. She gained their trust through kitty parties and false claims, ultimately running a chit-fund business.

title: Bihar SIR row: Rahul repeats ‘chunav chori’ charge; alleges fresh 'conspiracy' by EC
content: Rahul Gandhi alleges that the Election Commission is working for the BJP. He claims a conspiracy to steal the Bihar election, similar to Maharashtra. He questions the sudden increase in voters in Maharashtra. He says the Election Commission isn't providing voter lists. The Supreme Court upheld the Election Commission's voter roll revision in Bihar.

title: IND vs ENG 3rd Test: Pant spotted at Lord's on Day 2 - latest injury update
content: Rishabh Pant's injured index finger cast doubt on his participation in the ongoing Lord's Test against England. After being struck on Day 1, Pant's discomfort during batting drills on Day 2 suggests Dhruv Jurel will likely continue as wicketkeeper. Pant's injury occurred while attempting to stop a delivery, leading to treatment and observation by the medical team and coaches.

title: 'Son of Sardaar 2' trailer: Ajay Devgn returns with desi swagger, Mrunal Thakur joins fun
content: Get ready for a laughter riot! 'Son of Sardaar 2' trailer is finally here, promising a blend of action, comedy, and desi punchlines with a Scottish twist. Ajay Devgn returns as the energetic Jassi, joined by Mrunal Thakur as the new romantic lead. The sequel opens with the tagline: “He survived Punjab, will he survive Scotland too?”

title: Countering China: India eyes Rs 1,345 crore scheme on rare earth magnets; details
content: India is set to focus on domestic production of rare earth magnets with a Rs 1,345 crore investment, aiming to reduce reliance on China, which controls a huge chunk of global processing. This move follows China's export restrictions on these crucial materials.

title: IND vs ENG 3rd Test: Why are spectators wearing red at Lord's?
content: The #RedForRuth campaign, honouring Ruth Strauss, returns for its seventh year at Lord's during the England-India Test. Spectators are encouraged to wear red to support the Ruth Strauss Foundation's mission of aiding families facing terminal illness. The initiative has already significantly impacted bereavement support, with all proceeds from the day contributing to this vital cause.

title: Bumper launch! Starlink, Jio-SES, Eutelsat secure final nod; India may soon get satcom services
content: India anticipates the commercial launch of satellite communication services as early as December, with Starlink, Reliance Jio-SES, and Bharti-backed Eutelsat OneWeb securing necessary approvals. Spectrum allotment delays previously hindered launches, costing potential revenue.

title: Rs 49,000cr ponzi scheme: Accused held; 5 crore investors duped in one of India’s biggest frauds
content: Uttar Pradesh's Economic Offences Wing arrested Gurnam Singh, a director at Pearls Agro-Tech Corporation Limited, for his involvement in a massive Rs 49,000 crore Ponzi scheme. PACL allegedly defrauded five crore investors across 10 states by promising land plots and high returns, but failed to deliver. The company operated without proper NBFC registration, luring investors with deceptive real estate schemes.

title: Gurgaon tennis player murder: Killer father sent to 1-day police remand; all you need to know
content: In a shocking incident in Gurgaon, Deepak Yadav has been remanded to police custody for allegedly murdering his 25-year-old daughter, Radhika Yadav. The incident occurred at their Sector 57 home, where Radhika was reportedly shot multiple times in the kitchen. Neighbors, alerted by gunshots, witnessed the aftermath.

title: Mysuru: Family of 4 attacked with machetes in full public view; accused on the run
content: In Mysuru, a family of four was violently attacked with machetes while riding in an auto-rickshaw on Ramanuja Road. A black car intercepted the auto, and a group of men emerged to assault the occupants in public.

title: West Bengal: TMC neta shot, neck slashed; MLA alleges ISF role in gruesome attack
content: A TMC leader, Razzak Khan, was brutally murdered near his home in Bhangar Chaltaberia on Thursday night. He was shot multiple times and attacked with sharp weapons after returning from a party meeting. Saokat Molla, a Canning East MLA, has accused ISF-backed individuals of the crime, demanding immediate arrests as police investigate the incident, reviewing CCTV footage and questioning locals.

title: Bihar voter list revision: BJP calls out Congress' stance on Aadhaar
content: The BJP has accused Congress of hypocrisy regarding Aadhaar's use in voter identification. This follows the Supreme Court's suggestion to the Election Commission about Bihar's electoral roll revision. The BJP highlights Congress's past opposition to linking Voter ID with Aadhaar, contrasting it with their current demand to include Aadhaar as proof during the revision process, alleging it could enfranchise non-citizens.

title: Father's insecurity and Instagram reels: What led to tennis player Radhika Yadav’s murder?
content: In Gurugram, Haryana, 25-year-old tennis player Radhika Yadav was fatally shot by her father, Deepak Yadav, at their home. Police arrested Deepak, who confessed, citing his disapproval of Radhika's tennis academy as the motive. Other explored theories include his discontent with her social media presence and insecurities about relying on her income, despite the family's stable financial situation.

title: Canada tightens financial requirements for international students- all you need to know
content: Canada has announced stricter financial requirements for international students applying for study permits from September 1, 2025. Applicants must now show higher funds for living expenses, transportation, and tuition without relying on employment. The minimum financial threshold for a single applicant has increased to CAN$22,895. Requirements also vary by family size and location, with separate figures for Québec. Acceptable financial proof and documentation standards have also been updated in line with the new rules.

title: Nifty50 dips below 25,200; Sensex down over 700 points - top reasons
content: Stock market crash today: Nifty50 and BSE Sensex, the Indian equity benchmark indices, tanked in trade on Friday.  Analysts noted that uncertainties regarding tariffs and mixed global market conditions contributed to the downward pressure.

title: How much of Vitamin D is too much, and how overdose can cause kidney toxicity
content: Vitamin D is crucial for bone health and immunity, obtainable through sunlight and diet. Supplements, however, can lead to toxicity if dosages exceed the recommended 400-800 IU daily intake. Excessive vitamin D causes hypercalcemia, potentially damaging kidneys and leading to serious health issues. Consulting a doctor before taking supplements is essential to avoid toxicity.

title: Filth behind beauty: Polish tourists highlight garbage near Taj Mahal, say ‘it stinks terribly’
content: A Polish travel vlogger's video exposing garbage and sewage near the Taj Mahal has ignited a social media firestorm, sparking debate about India's cleanliness. The footage shows tourists reacting negatively to the unhygienic conditions, prompting mixed reactions online. While some applaud the vloggers for raising awareness, others accuse them of negatively portraying India.

title: Father fired 3 bullets at tennis coach Radhika; insecurity suspected as motive
content: In a shocking incident in Gurgaon, junior international tennis player Radhika Yadav was allegedly shot dead by her father, Deepak Yadav, at their residence. The motive appears to be a disagreement over Radhika's tennis academy, which caused friction between them. Deepak has been arrested, and police recovered the licensed weapon.

title: Shrimp cocktails, crackers & more: Shubhanshu Shukla's joyful dinner on space station; see pics
content: Indian Air Force Group Captain Shubhanshu Shukla, part of the Ax-4 mission, is set to return to Earth after an unforgettable evening on the ISS. The crew, including Shukla, shared a meal and stories, celebrating international collaboration in space. Shukla made history as the first Indian on a private ISS mission, contributing to over 60 experiments.

title: IND vs ENG Test Day 2: Jamie Smith leads England’s fightback after Bumrah’s triple blow
content: Bumrah removed Joe Root (104), Ben Stokes (44) and Chris Woakes (0) in a devastating seven-ball burst across two overs to reduce England from 251/4 to 271/7.

title: TMC, BJP in fresh face-off over detention of Bengali-speaking migrant workers
content: The TMC MP demanded proof for Mr. Malviya's claims that 335 out of 444 detained migrants in Odisha possessed fake documents allegedly issued by the West Bengal government.

title: 22 Naxalites with collective bounty of ₹37.5 lakh surrender in Narayanpur: Chhattisgarh CM
content: Chief Minister Vishnu Deo Sai hailed the success and said that Maoists now want to shun guns and walk together on the path of development

title: IISc convocation: Soon AI models will be able to correctly solve any undergraduate science problems, says mathematician Manjul Bhargava
content: Addressing the Indian Institute of Science (IISc) convocation in Bengaluru on July 11, he said that currently AI remains notoriously bad at doing math and science

title: Alert sounded as water level in Godavari rises at Polavaram
content: Flood level in Godavari River was 36 feet at the project; the officials discharged about 6 lakh cusecs to the downstream

title: Cabinet during BRS rule met 6 times, took decisions on Kaleshwaram Barrages: Harish Rao
content: Party leader T. Harish Rao says he submitted additional information to the Ghose Commission; He adds that BRS suspects that Government is giving misleading information to the panel

title: Parents cautioned against allowing minor children to drive vehicles
content: Those who repeatedly violate this rule will face criminal cases and their licences will be suspended permanently, the Kurnool District Superintendent of Police said

title: 5 workers killed, four injured as borewell drilling truck falls into ravine in Chhattisgarh
content: Five workers killed, four injured in Chhattisgarh truck accident; identities of deceased workers yet to be confirmed

title: 8 illegal immigrants ‘pushed back’ into Bangladesh: Assam CM
content: Assam CM Himanta Biswa Sarma said protecting Assam’s interests is foremost for his government, and illegal immigrants will not be allowed to stay in Assam and threaten its identity

title: KITTS carves a niche in tour and travel education
content: In a first, seven MBA Travel and Tourism students from KITTS got placed in foreign countries through campus placements

title: FIR against AAP over 'doctored video' of Punjab Congress leader Partap Bajwa
content: In his complaint, Pratap Singh Bajwa had sought an FIR against the Aam Aadmi Party, "their concerned leaders and their henchmen in fabricating videos against me"

title: New formula for KEAM 2025 rank list was scientific, reasserts Kerala Minister for Higher Education R. Bindu
content: Minister says new formula was introduced as students in State syllabus could lose up to 35 marks even if they had scored full marks in exams in view of the existing standardisation process

title: Karnataka CM enacting ‘drama’ over demand of Devanahalli farmers to drop land acquisition proceedings, alleges actor Prakash Raj
content: Accusing the State Government of involvement in ‘real estate business’, Prakash Raj sought to know the reason for acquiring the land without obtaining permission from the Centre for the proposed defence and aerospace corridors

title: File written response to AIADMK’s plea on early decision in ‘two leaves’ symbol row, Madras High Court directs ECI
content: Justices R. Subramanian and K. Surender direct the Election Commission to ensure that its written response is filed by July 21

title: PAV reiterates demand to withdraw decision on privatisation of government medical colleges in Andhra Pradesh
content: PAV says that in light of the recent unethical practices by private medical colleges, unearthed by the CBI, the State Government should reconsider its decision on privatisation

title: Approach education reforms with prudence, Muslim Jamat tells Kerala government
content: Education reforms should be implemented in a manner that is transparent, just and responsive to concerns of students and parents, according to Kerala Muslim Jamat

title: Non-cognisable case being filed against Shiv Sena MLA in canteen worker assault incident: Police
content: After the incident, which happened on July 8, 2025 night, sparked a furore, the two-time Buldhana MLA refused to express regret and said he would repeat his actions if needed

title: Mahesh Goud credits 42% BC reservations to Kharge, Rahul Gandhi and Revanth Reddy
content: Goud reiterated that this reservation push is part of Rahul Gandhi’s national agenda, now being fulfilled with Revanth Reddy’s firm commitment in Telangana

title: Block all websites displaying private images and videos of woman advocate, orders Madras High Court
content: Justice N. Anand Venkatesh passes the order after MeitY says it would not be possible to take down the woman’s images and videos alone from those websites

title: India's population at crossroads, not a crisis: Population Foundation of India
content: World Population Day is being observed under the global theme: 'empowering young people to create the families they want in a fair and hopeful world'

title: Four paramedical staff of Rangaraya Medical College suspended on charges of sexual harassment
content: Three accused were arrested on Friday following complaints of sexual harassment to the internal inquiry committee by 55 B.Sc students; the issue came to light after the College Principal received an anonymous email on July 9

title: Gurugram tennis player murder: Court sends accused father Deepak to police custody for a day
content: 25-year-old Radhika Yadav was shot dead by her father, allegedly over a disagreement regarding her tennis academy in Sector 57 in Gurugram

title: Karnataka to finalise board, corporation appointments on July 16
content: Appointment of members to boards and corporations in Karnataka is a politically significant process, and is often used to balance internal party dynamics and reward loyalty.

title: Conservationists urge prioritising wildlife welfare over re-laying of road cutting through tiger reserve
content: Work on the 14-kilometre stretch, which cuts through pristine habitats of endangered species of wildlife, had been held up due to a dispute between the Forest department and the District Rural Development Agency (DRDA) over the width of the road

title: Karnataka government takes over Gali Anjaneya Swamy temple in Bengaluru
content: Government decided to step in after CCTV footage showing temple staff allegedly stealing money while counting the donations and offerings in the hundi (donation box) went viral on social media

title: ED conducts another round of searches in “U.S. Donkey Route” case
content: The probe agency had said that it has recovered 30 original passports and got hold of the names of various agents and immigration agencies running the "donkey route" business

title: Vadodara bridge collapse: Structural failure caused collapse, says Gujarat Minister
content: The death toll in the Vadodara bridge collapse rose to 19 on Friday (July 11, 2025) after one of the injured succumbed to his injuries.

title: BJP making attempts to steal elections in Bihar as it did in Maharashtra: Rahul Gandhi
content: Congress president Mallikarjun Kharge alleged that the BJP-led central government was attempting to omit secularism and socialism from the Constitution.

title: Notice to Goa University V-C over ‘underwear parade’ in cultural festival
content: The moves follows after a 'Third Degree' competition in February, where the jury asked the participants to strip to their underwear.

title: Siddaramaiah, D.K. Shivakumar again dismiss speculation on Karnataka CM change
content: Siddramaiah, who is in Delhi, met with Congress President Mallikarjun Kharge along with other senior party leaders, fanning the speculation over a possible CM change in Karnataka.

title: Train from KSR Bengaluru to Kannur, Ernakulam daily Superfast Express and Nanded daily Express to originate and terminate at SMVT for 153 days
content: Train Nos. 16511/16512 KSR Bengaluru-Kannur Express, Train Nos. 12677/678 KSR Bengaluru-Ernakulam daily Superfast Express and Train No. 16593/594 KSR Bengaluru-Nanded daily Express would be diverted to run from SMVT Bengaluru

title: Placed under house arrest, not allowed to offer prayers at Jamia Masjid: Hurriyat Conference chairman Mirwaiz Umar Farooq
content: "Disallowed to go to Jama Masjid today, put under house arrest, fearing the mention of the martyrs of 13th July 1931 in my friday sermon!" Mirwaiz Umar Farooq said

title: Former CJIs Khehar, Chandrachud appear before parliamentary committee on simultaneous elections
content: The Joint Committee of Parliament headed by BJP MP P.P. Chaudhary has been speaking to jurists and legal experts as it prepares its recommendation on the bill

title: Search operation resumes at Gujarat bridge tragedy site, two still missing
content: Efforts are still underway to trace two more persons, who are missing, Vadodara Collector Anil Dhameliya said

title: Four islands cut-off in Konaseema; 2.96 lakh cusecs of Godavari floodwater released into Bay of Bengal
content: Heavy inflows into Godavari from Odisha’s Sileru river Sabari river from Chhattisgarh are contributing to the rise

title: Objectionable social media posts against PM Modi, RSS: Cartoonist moves SC for anticipatory bail
content: The complaint alleged that Hemant Malviya “hurt the religious sentiments of Hindus and disturbed communal harmony by uploading objectionable material on social media”

title: RSS chief’s remarks on stepping aside at 75 stir political row
content: Opposition links RSS chief Mohan Bhagwat’s comments to PM Modi’s upcoming milestone; Sangh dismisses interpretation as out of context

title: Assam Government to open 80 more schools in tea garden areas
content: CM Himanta Biswa Sarma said that with the vision of bringing about qualitative changes in the academic landscape of the tea garden areas, Assam Government has decided to set up 200 model schools in 800 tea estates across the State

title: ‘First decide which party you belong to’: Muraleedharan’s dig at Shashi Tharoor over CM survey
content: Mr. Muraleedharan further said that there were several senior leaders in the Kerala unit of Congress who would be considered for the post of CM, irrespective of what any survey says

title: Gurugram tennis player murder: Uncle says victim's mother on same floor when shooting happened
content: It was earlier said that her mother was on the ground floor, and she rushed upstairs after hearing the gunshots, which, she said, sounded like a pressure cooker blast

title: Wanted drug producer deported to India from UAE, Mumbai police take his custody
content: Mustafa was chargesheeted in Mumbai and a special court had issued an open-dated arrest warrant against him

title: Controversial question in B.A. History exam in West Bengal’s Vidyasagar University sparks outrage
content: In the examination that took place on July 9, the question paper on Modern Nationalism of India carried a question that asked, “Name three district magistrates of Midnapore who were killed by terrorists,” apparently terming the freedom fighters as  “shontrashbadi” (terrorists).

title: RSS chief Bhagwat’s ‘stepping aside’ remark: What kind of homecoming is this for PM Modi, Congress leader Jairam Ramesh takes dig
content: During an event in Nagpur, RSS chief Bhagwat mentioned Sangh ideologue late Moropant Pingley's statement about stepping aside after 75 years of age

title: Woman caretaker kills retired AE; escapes with cash in Vijayawada’s NTR Colony
content: Venkata Rama Rao was staying with his ninety-year-old mother Saraswathi and engaged Anusha to take care of his mother

title: 10th batch of over 6,400 pilgrims leaves Jammu for twin base camps of Amarnath
content: Over 1.30 lakh pilgrims have paid obeisance at the shrine since the start of the 38-day annual yatra through the twin tracks of Pahalgam in Anantnag district and Baltal in Ganderbal district on July 3

title: Confusion over HSRP enforcement leaves Hyderabad commuters frustrated
content: What has sparked discontent is not the fine itself, but the lack of clarity on how to obtain HSRPs, especially for vehicles registered before the current system was introduced in 2019.

title: Indian Coast Guard rescues two U.S. nationals stranded at sea near Andaman and Nicobar islands
content: ICG Ship Rajveer reached the U.S.-flagged sailing vessel ‘Sea Angel’, established communication with the stranded crew, and conducted an on-site assessment

title: Ironical that an atheist nation like China wants to interfere in Dalai Lama succession: BJP MP
content: MPs across party lines are collecting signatures to petition Union government for a Bharat Ratna for the Dalai Lama

title: Bihar Deputy Chief Minister welcomes Supreme Court step to allow SIR of electoral roll
content: The Opposition Rashtriya Janata Dal said they welcomed Supreme Court asking EC to include Aadhar and other cards into SIT exercise

title: Mumbai’s Carnac Bridge renamed as Sindoor after Operation Sindoor
content: ‘The Sindoor is named after the success of Operation Sindoor to wipe the pages of India’s black history where the then Governor Carnac for years carried out atrocities against Indians, said Maharashtra CM Fadnavis,

title: IIT Kharagpur’s ‘campus mothers’ programme draws mixed response
content: While some have lauded the institute for promoting welfare initiatives, mental health professionals have raised concerns around its gendered nature and the ethics of confidentiality and non-judgement

title: Two pistols, 6 hand-grenades among consignment recovered in Jammu and Kashmir's Poonch
content: A joint search operation was launched by the police, Special Operations Group, and the Army in the general area of Khanetar and adjoining areas in the district

title: Veteran statesman, former Council Chairman N. Thippanna passes away at 97
content: Thippanna mortal remains will be kept at his Ballari residence for public homage, and the final rites will be conducted on July 12, 2025 in his native village of Turuvanur in Chitradurga district

title: Three officials from NIMZ, Zaheerabad in ACB net
content: All three officers were arrested and produced before the special court for SPE and ACB cases in Nampally

title: Credit rating of Sigachi revised to ‘rating watch with negative implications’
content: The agency said it would continue to monitor the impact of the incident on revenue, profitability and cash flows and long-term impact, if any, of outcome from ongoing investigations

title: SI of Gachibowli women police station arrested by Telangana ACB
content: According to the ACB, the accused officer, identified as K.Y. Venu Gopal, demanded and received the bribe from a complainant in exchange for removing the name of the complainant’s mother from a case

title: Gujarat’s ‘Namo Lakshmi Yojana’ disburses ₹924 crore, benefits over 10 lakh girl students
content: Launched in 2024, the scheme provides ₹50,000 over four years to girls from families earning less than ₹6 lakh annually, helping them complete Classes 9 to 12

title: Nothing silky, smooth for sericulture farmers in Andhra Pradesh
content: Dearth of local markets, little government support and a devastating disorder that is rendering silkworms unable to spin cocoons have cornered sericulture farmers in Chebrolu, one of the largest mulberry plant cultivating belts in Andhra. As the crisis deepens, many have altogether abandoned the business, switching to cotton and oil palm, but some cling on to the hope that Chebrolu will survive and emerge as the State’s Silk City, writes T. Appala Naidu

title: Sigachi Industries explosion: A deafening blast, a lingering silence
content: On the morning of June 30, a powerful explosion tore through a chemical factory in Telangana’s Sangareddy district, its echo heard for kilometres. Forty-four workers were confirmed dead, over 30 injured, and at least eight remain missing. Most of the workforce were migrants, clocking long shifts for modest wages. As families gathered outside morgues and rescue zones, a grim picture began to emerge — of alleged ignored warnings, delayed responses and silence from those in charge, reports Naveen Kumar

title: Schools without rules in Bengaluru
content: From not being registered as per rules to not having land even to hold the morning assembly, many schools in Bengaluru are ‘unauthorised’ on several counts. But there is no consistent effort to monitor them and hold them to account

title: Review of ‘A House Without Cats and Other Stories: The Mozhi Prize Anthology 1’
content: The inaugural Mozhi Prize anthology, with nine Tamil stories in translation, highlights the diversity of tone and form in contemporary regional fiction

title: Column | Vikrant Bhise’s shades of blue
content: The artist is on a mission to take our 3,000-year history of caste-based oppression to a wider global audience

title: Chennai’s Madhya Kailash junction: only for the bravehearts among pedestrians
content: Pedestrians often form groups and cross the road amid traffic, sometimes dangerously, especially when vehicles take the bus bay side from Rajiv Gandhi Salai.

title: No income tax notice has been sent to Eknath Shinde’s son: Sources
content: “It may also kindly be noted no notice has been issued to Shri. Srikanth Shinde, son of Shri. Eknath Shinde,” the source clarified.

title: Bombay HC dismisses PIL challenging transfer of salt pan lands for Dharavi redevelopment project affected people
content: The lawyer Sagar Devre challenged the State’s decision to hand over the salt pan land parcel in Mulund, Kanjurmarg and Bhandup to Adani for a rental housing scheme for ineligible residents of Dharavi and the Union Ministry of Commerce and Industry’s Office Memorandum (OM), which enables the transfer of land.

title: Language ‘test’ for Assam’s Bengal-origin Muslims
content: Chief Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma said Bengal-origin Muslims not listing Assamese as their mother tongue in public documents will help the government know the number of foreigners

title: Kerala High Court grants anticipatory bail to ED official
content: He allegedly demanded ₹2 crore as bribe through an intermediary from a cashew businessman to extricate him from a money-laundering case

title: Government failed to ensure MSP for key crops, alleges Jagan
content: Over 76,000 mango farmers cultivating in over 2.2 lakh acres have been forced to throw away their produce due to a lack of MSP, he asserts

title: Calcutta HC division bench upholds order banning ‘tainted’ candidates from WB school recruitment process
content: On July 7, the single bench of Justice Sougata Bhattacharya had  debarred ‘tainted’ candidates from the recruitment process conducted by WBSSC. The WB govt and WBSSC has approached the division bench against the single bench order.

title: Shivamogga resident moves Karnataka High Court on his plea for ‘B.S. Yediyurappa bridge’
content: The petitioner has said that he has given a representation to the Ministry of Road Transport and Highways, and the National Highways Authority of India (NHAI) on July 7 requesting them to name the new bridge, which is scheduled to be inaugurated on July 14, as “B.S. Yediyurappa” bridge considering the contribution of Mr. Yediyurappa to the State as Chief Minister.

title: ‘Relief for democracy’, says Congress on Supreme Court's suggestion on voter list revision in Bihar
content: Congress general secretary K.C. Venugopal says the court asking the EC to allow Aadhaar cards, ration cards and voter ID cards for the identification of voters during the special exercise is in itself a big thing

title: Maharashtra Assembly passes public security Bill; law won’t be misused: CM
content: Draft legislation tabled by CM approved by majority through voice vote after two-hour discussion; CPI opposes Bill, other Opposition parties raise objections; Bill will now be tabled in Legislative Council

title: Will casual boxing fans ever love Shakur Stevenson?
content: Shakur Stevenson will be matched against the organization's "interim" belt-holder, William Zepeda (33-0, 27 KOs) he's the third weight class in which he has now held titles . he is a huge source of consternation within the boxing business .

title: The 30 players you need to pay attention to in summer league, from Atlanta to Washington
content: the 11-day tournament begins Thursday and runs through July 20 . the event will be headlined by the fresh faces of the 2025 draft class . top 2025 picks Cooper Flagg, Dylan Harper and VJ Edgecombe will all be in action .

title: Cooper Flagg's first summer league game: Top plays, takeaways and future impact
content: Cooper Flagg made his highly anticipated debut for the Dallas Mavericks on Thursday . the matchup boasted the highest average ticket price for a summer league game since Victor Wembanyama's debut . he finished with 10 points, 6 rebounds and 4 assists as Dallas bested los Angeles .

title: Power Rankings: Where every team stands heading into the All-Star break
content: the baseball world will pause to watch some of the biggest names in the sport participate in the Home Run Derby and All-Star Game in Atlanta . a number of teams might welcome the reset that comes with the all-Star break . red-hot clubs such as the Blue Jays and Tigers will hope to ride their momentum into the second half .

title: Who dropped out of the top 10? Players eyeing a bounce-back at TE, RB and edge
content: sportsmail's survey of the top 10 players at every position is unveiled . ranked candidates based on top-10 votes, composite average and interviews . more than 70 voters submitted a ballot on at least one position, and in many cases all positions .

title: A'ja Wilson, Josh Allen among 2025 ESPYS candidates; vote now
content: the 2025 ESPYS presented by Capital One are July 16 . the Oklahoma City Thunder guard is nominated in two categories: Best Athlete - Men's Sports, and Best NBA Player . Simone Biles and Sydney McLaughlin-Levrone are up for best . Ilona Maher and Ezra Frech represent in both categories .

title: Mahomes in Round 11? WRs, RBs prioritized in 8-team mock draft
content: some fantasy football mock drafts are for leagues with 10 or 12 teams . fewer starting slots than in larger leagues, there are notable differences in draft approach . most obvious comes at quarterback, where only five were selected in the first 10 rounds .

title: Who had the NHL's best offseason? Grades for all 32 teams
content: the compressed offseason is an opportunity for every front office to improve its roster . some general managers need just a few players to remain a top Stanley Cup contender . others need to be a bit more aggressive to raise their club's competitive level .

content: e-Paper The View From India Looking at World Affairs from the Indian perspective . the weekly newsletter from science writers takes the jargon out of science and puts the fun in! TIRUCHI Athulya Senior Care, through its “Caring For A Senior” initiative, has donated wheelchairs to the Srirangam Sri Ranganathaswamy temple.
